intro: Neotatea longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved neotatea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves that can reach several meters in length. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically appearing in the upper part of the plant. Neotatea longifolia is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
